I would recommend The Essential Journey over this CD, but combine this 
Greatest hits with Greatest Hits 2 and you have a wonderful selection of 
the songs that made Journey so popular. This is a group that is associated 
with the 80's, but their success really began in the 70's. While not as 
popular today as they were in the 80's, Journey has been recording original 
music and touring for 40 years. The years during Steve Perry's membership 
in Journey were the most successful for the band in no small part due to 
the vocal and lyrical abilities of Steve Perry that are represented on this 
CD. The band has never regained that level of popularity as they do not 
seem to understand that it is not just the tone of voice or range that 
Steve Perry brought to the band, but the inflections and understanding of 
where a singers voice fits into the music. A subtle motown influence in 
Steve Perry and the hard rock, latin and fusion roots of Neal Schon created 
a sound that had more substance than the typical hair band contemporaries 
of those days.

wholeheartedly. RU MINE is the only song on this album that seems to be

A tall can of cool beans I can't stop listening to this album. The lyrics and the voice are so

Amazing love this band and alex turner always and yes many say the songs sound the

AM Brilliant album in a unique style that only AM could perfect. Not sure how 
haters can be haters of music this good!

Incredible. Without skipping a beat, Arctic Monkeys continues to expand what sounds 
they want to represent themselves with. Give it a few listens, and every 
song becomes a hit. It's a stylish blend of pop and rock and 
leather-jacket-wearing-badassery that only this artist could pull off. 
Between this and Suck It And See, they're easily my favorite band.

I liked Do I Wanna Know when I first heard it, so I gave the other singles 
a try. The first two I heard sounded so similar I mistook them for DIWK. ( 
Not to mention R U Mine? completely rips off Swamp Song by Blur) Arctic 
Monkeys have been swallowed up by Alex's newfound pretentiousness and it's 
horrible. I'll be in the corner, listening to Brianstorm.

One of the best. I was counting down the days until AM came out. It was so worth it. Bloody 
amazing.

Do I Wanna Know?' WHY YES, YES YOU DO. The band? Rocking. The lyrics are so much more 
in-depth when front-man Alex delves deeper into his confusing struggle of 
love from his more recent years. The bass and drums have definitely taken a 
new direction but it seems as if whichever route the band take to win over 
the hearts of their fans, those such as I, they will succeed and it is 
their sheer brilliance and total musical talent that allow them to do so. 
If the Arctic Monkeys don't win this, then I'm afraid the world has 
officially lost it's evermore-needed understanding of music provided by 
these lyrical geniuses that comprise to make the realist band out there - 
BY FAR. Never have I felt the need to love an inanimate object like it were 
a person until now - you can't help but fall in love!

Not as good as their older stuff Although the songs are good, the overall feel has evolved from the more 
cleansed feel of Suck it and See and detracted from the unpolished feel the 
band had with What Ever People Say, Favourite Worst Nightmare and the 
various unreleased songs and B-sides from their early days. Hopefully after 
their hiatus, they will revert back to their former, more unique self 
rather than moving further along this route and fulfilling the prophecy of 
the band in Fake Tales of San Francisco.

Wow! I'm always nervous when a band I love releases a new album, afraid that 
they will stray away from the sound I love. Arctic monkeys has been on of 
my favorite bands since 2006, and I have to say I was pleasantly shocked to 
hear this album! Their new style is great, I would describe it as "cool", 
"smooth", and "sexy" especially one for the road and knee socks, where he's 
almost rapping in a way in parts of the song. I'm seeing them live at the 
state theatre, Portland Maine in two weeks, so excited!

One the best of 2013 AM seem to get better & better. So talented and unique sounding. Love, 
love, love them. They are FABULOUS live! Was fortunate enough to see them 
at the acl festival 2013 in Austin, Texas. Was into them a little prior to 
seeing them live, thanks to altnation on Sirius. After seeing them live, I 
am a fan and cannot get enough of AM!

Good but not there best. This album is miles better than the atrocious suck it and see, but no

Besides that songs like r u mine and do you want know never get old because

'Arabella' is so influenced by 'Sabbath's' 'War Pigs'. Listen to it☺

More of the same, but thats not bad Some might say that sounding like your older stuff is a bad thing, but 9 
years after "Dear Agony" and a line-up change, it's nice to know if you 
loved them then, you shouldn't find anything too scary

A Long Awaited Arrival Let me start of by saying this... This album is probably the best from 
them ever! It's not easy to re-group and put together an all new lineup, 
while still sounding the same as with the Phobia and Dear Agony albums. 
Waited 6 effin' years for this! Totally was worth the wait! Personally my 
favorite songs off this album are #1 Bury Me Alive, #2 Failure & #3 
Defeated. Once again this epic album you should hear, even if you don't 
like rock/alternative... Do yourself a favor & listen to it, you won't 
regret it!

very disappointing :(

23rd. I pre ordered and didnt get the song. Will change when I get my song.

Waited to rate until I heard the whole album. Unlike others. Lol. Breaking Benjamin is one of the few bands that can actually have great 
albums other than their 1st album. It's hard to do but everyone of their 
albums is hard rock greatness! I hope many more come from this band!

Love the new album! Been waiting a long time. It had been a long time since we'd seen a Breaking Benjamin album, and I'm 
not disappointed at all! Love this new album!

Breaking Benjamin is back! The wait was totally worth it. Their sound and style remains true to how 
it was before their hiatus. Very nostalgic yet very refreshing to hear new 
content. Welcome back BB!

Fantastic The album is fantastic. Breaking Benjamin restored my faith in the music 
industry. They made an awesome record filled with feelings from Ben's 
stories. Long live rock!

Good comeback Nice to finally hear some new material from them. Dear Agony is still my 
favourite, but this is cool.

The perfect comeback to a highly-anticipated band! They did an amazing job with their comback album! It sounds a bit darker 
than songs I've heard from these guys in the past, but I'll be damned if 
they dont sound amazing!

The band going from a 4-piece to a 5-piece makes the music sounds tighter. 
On most BB CDs I have usually 6-8 tracks I keep in regular rotation. I can 
say all but two songs on here (including the intro "Dark" and the outro 
"Dawn") will be in my playlist. I love the element of more backing vocals 
on this one, and the ultrasound of his son on the cover was a cool little 
Easter Egg. Plucking Jason Rauch from Red, and Keith Wallen from Copper are 
opportunities you just can't pass up, and Ben looks like he's having fun on 
stage for the first time in many years. So, who was that Valora band that 
was the catalyst for the last four years of tribulation?! Oh yeah...nowhere 
to be found.

Pennsylvania rock at it's finest Ben and the new band have outdone themselves for sure. I've been a fan 
since 2002 when Saturate took off with Polyamorous. They make me proud to 
be from Pa and watching them grow over the years has touched me. This new 
installment of songs is honest and quite frankly, possibly some of their 
best material to date. Buy this album and check out the boys on tour. You 
won't regret it!!!

Glad to have a new album It's a bit too much like Dear Agony for me. Would love to see a return to 
the style of Phobia or Saturate. Either way, glad to have Breaking Benjamin 
back!

An album not to be missed Breaking Benjamin went through a serious change, Ben Burnley himself went 
through serious changes. And he's still sick, but said he chooses to write, 
perform and melt our faces over letting his sickness win the fight. I 
support the overall goal and message this band is delivering. It is a 
testament to everything he has experienced over the last few years 
including the welcoming of a new child. This album brings a lot of 
nostalgia to mind and I rarely write reviews. This merits one.

All of the songs are amazing Breaking Benjamin dark before dawn its incredible welcome back Ben after 6 
year you came back stronger than ever.

Amazing I haven't ordered it on Google play since its available on Spotify and 
I've already downloaded it on iTunes but this is an awesome album anyways. 
I've listened for many years and have loved every album ever since their 
first. Ashes of Eden is personally my favorite track on the album (I've 
been listening to the album on iTunes first play for at least a week). So 
glad BB is back!

Nothing short of perfection. This year went the way I thought it would: Three Days Grace disappointed 
me, Breaking Benjamin's "Dark Before Dawn" did not.

I've waited so long for this album. This band saved my life. I was in a 
very dark place when I stumbled across Breaking Benjamin. Some days, their 
music was the only escape I had from the hell around me. I was disappointed 
when I seen that they had gone their separate ways, but ohh the joy when I 
learned of this release. You guys rock! This sounds awesome. You guys are 
definitely clooose to heaven!! If not heaven itself. Keep up the fantastic 
sound!!

Good to be back The wait between Dear Agony and now was long, but definitely worth it! 
Great album!

Love this band! I have been listening to breaking Benjamin for probably 10 plus years and 
once I found out they were making a new album I was excited and they still 
impress me. Even with how music is changing in today's world breaking 
Benjamin still manages to keep the great sound of rock that I love!

Finally! I've been a fan of Breaking Benjamin for almost a year now, and I love 
every one of their songs. Sadly, I don't have any of their albums. Mainly 
because my parents are strict about what I listen to... Anyway, I was 
listening to Pandora on my phone, and "Failure" came on for the first time. 
When I saw it was by Breaking Benjamin, I freaked out! I couldn't believe 
they we're finally making music again! I just asked my grandma to buy this 
album for me when it comes out, and she said yes! I'm so excited!! :D

Awesome Album Welcome Back Awesome Album Dear Agony was Cool But This One Is Great Played It All The 
Way Threw With No Skipping It's A Dark Album And I Love That

Back in stride! Breaking Benjamin have come back with a lot of gusto on this record. It's 
heavy, it's melodic, and the new members are just as talented if not more 
so than the old lot. The guitar work is tight and the mix isn't overdone; 
it packs a nice punch and nothing is lost. Ben's vocal harmonies are better 
than ever. This is among their best work. My only gripe is it's too short 
but, it's still way better than Dear Agony! If you liked Phobia, you'll 
love Dark Before Dawn.

New perspective. Changed my rating after listening to the album from a new perspective and 
it's a work of art. I've been a fan since Saturate and am still a doe hard 
fan.

Same old Breaking Benjamin, with a weaker band behind Ben Breaking Benjamin certainly has a consistent sound, but it has gotten to a 
point where there is no longer an allure to the band's music. On top of 
Breaking Benjamin's redundancy, the instrumental band is arguably worse 
than year's past, even with Jasen Rauch in the mix. The music is so even 
keel, with no ups and down, no surprises. For me, it's not worth the 
purchase. One album listen through was enough.

100 percent enjoyable no reason to dislike it. It breaking bejamin greatest

best songs on the album

Good pop music This album will not change your life in any meaningful way. It will 
entertain you if you like catchy pop melodies. Sometimes the sex appeal 
gets in the way, but the songs on this album are always more important than 
the fact that Katy Perry is beautiful. I only wish that were the case with 
Lady Gaga, whose collaborators seem to think her weak sexed-up Christina 
Aguilera impression is somehow "innovative".

Best yet from Katy I love all the tracks on this CD. I expected so much when I saw it, I 
bought the deluxe version. I wasn't disappointed, and hadn't wasted £3 on 3 
more (epic) tracks. It's started off with the Summer 2013 hit 'Roar'. To be 
totally honest, this is the worst track on the CD, so if you liked 'Roar', 
you love 'Prism'. I have Katy's other two more recent albums and this beats 
'One of the Boys' & 'Teenage Dream' (even the Complete Confection edition) 
by far. An EPIC BUY, and worth its price tag.

I love Kenny. I've grew up listening to him and his music is truly amazing.

great as his last album "Hemming Whiskey" & the same thing with "Welcome To

is why Kenny Chesney is my favorite artist.

Excellent I have been a long time fan of KC. Have seen him live four times, one show 
better than the next. Unfortunately though, I have found much of his new 
music after the "No Shoes, No Shirt, No Problem" album to be mediocre at 
best. Fortunately, his new album "The Big Revival" is a return to form on a 
grand scale. I knew he had this album in him somewhere. Buy it. This will 
go down as one of his best. Lots of feel good, party tunes. Can't wait to 
see him live next Summer.
